docs.lead_paragraph: A program that now covers some eight million low-income children and is largely federally financed should be maintained.

headline.main: Children’s Health Insurance at a Crossroads
headline.print_headline: Children’s Health Insurance at a Crossroads

docs.abstract: Editorial calls on Congress to approve four-year extension for Children's Health Insurance Program, which supports low-income children whose families earn too much to qualify for Medicaid; argues that program must be maintained or a number of children who are now covered may encounter serious obstacles as they attempt to transition to health care exchanges.
docs.snippet: A program that now covers some eight million low-income children and is largely federally financed should be maintained.
